intro: Pityrodia obliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and semi-arid regions. Pityrodia obliqua is often found in heathlands and open forests, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
